paragraphs.text:
%md
# Blade&Soul user's churn prediction

## Introcution

![Blade&Soul](http://static.plaync.co.kr/gaiaupload/BladeNSoul/bbs/201306/wallpaper220130619115913.jpg)
Blade&Soul is Oriental fantasy massively multiplayer online role playing game (MMORPG) developed by NCSOFT. 
Unlike telecommunication services, **online game services cannot define an explicit deregistration as a churn.** According to ncsoft's analysis, deregistration users are no more than 1% of the long-term unconnected users who are assumed to have left the game service. Therefore, the long-term unconnected state should be redefined as a churn.
NCSOFT defined a user who does not play a game for more than five weeks as a churn. In this data, however, the churn criteria was reduced by three weeks.
![ChurnCriteria](https://cilab.sejong.ac.kr/gdmc2017/wp-content/uploads/2017/04/fig2.png)

## How to predict user who left the game

### Overview

![RNN Structure](http://t1.daumcdn.net/brunch/service/user/IgT/image/KOUKrZNca-XlF0gNKntfOSgzsbs.png)

We will use 'LSTM(long short term memory)' network to predict chrun. LSTM is a kind of RNN(Recurrent neural network).
Unlike DNN, RNN can learn sequential data because of its structure. In RNN's hidden layer, there is weight which feeds itself. When calculates hidden layer's value, rnn uses (current input*weight) and (prev hidden layer's value*weight which feeds itself). So, RNN's learning mechanism uses current data,but also prev data.

![LSTM Structure](http://t1.daumcdn.net/brunch/service/user/IgT/image/I0UJ8f2U5ePsX3LU-kJS--yIarU.png)

But, RNN also has problem which called long-term dependency.If input sequence is too long, RNN has affected by last data more and affected by prev data little.
LSTM can solve this problem by its specific structure.

### Input data

Game server leaves 'game log' which is created by user's action. There are many game log type in NCSOFT's game log.
We will use some game log types below.

|  Category   | LogID | LogName       | Description                                     |
|-------------|-------|---------------|-------------------------------------------------|
| Connection  |  1003 | EnterWorld    | When user enters the game-server                |
| Connection  |  1004 | LeaveWorld    | When user leaves the game-server                |
| Connection  |  1005 | EnterZone     | When user enters the zone                       |
| Connection  |  1006 | LeaveZone     | When user leaves the zone                       | 
| Connection  |  1010 | Teleport      | When user teleported using the magical method   |
| Connection  |  1013 | PCLevelUp     | When user’s character leveled up                |
| Character   |  1016 | GetExperience | When actor gets Exp                             |
| Character   |  1022 | GetItem       | When the items in the inventory are increased   |
| Character   |  1102 | JoinParty     | When user joined the party                      |
| Character   |  1202 | Die           | When actor died                                 |
| Character   |  1209 | KillPC        | When actor killed PC                            |

We have to pre-process this data. We will group data with 'userId' and 'date'.
But there is too many data to pre-process, so we will choose some userId to use.

![USER_LOG_LSTM_NETWORK](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7621901/32683884-1eec7aee-c6c2-11e7-993b-990d1464de87.png)

![NETWORK_QUESTION](https://scontent-icn1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/23031420_1483257105083182_4723745122961362324_n.jpg?oh=0797f636d54b130e1c5d19977dceb7ec&oe=5A6C05EB)

msg.data:
Blade&Soul user’s churn prediction

Introcution


Blade&Soul is Oriental fantasy massively multiplayer online role playing game (MMORPG) developed by NCSOFT.
Unlike telecommunication services, online game services cannot define an explicit deregistration as a churn. According to ncsoft’s analysis, deregistration users are no more than 1% of the long-term unconnected users who are assumed to have left the game service. Therefore, the long-term unconnected state should be redefined as a churn.
NCSOFT defined a user who does not play a game for more than five weeks as a churn. In this data, however, the churn criteria was reduced by three weeks.

How to predict user who left the game

Overview

We will use ‘LSTM(long short term memory)’ network to predict chrun. LSTM is a kind of RNN(Recurrent neural network).
Unlike DNN, RNN can learn sequential data because of its structure. In RNN’s hidden layer, there is weight which feeds itself. When calculates hidden layer’s value, rnn uses (current input*weight) and (prev hidden layer’s value*weight which feeds itself). So, RNN’s learning mechanism uses current data,but also prev data.

But, RNN also has problem which called long-term dependency.If input sequence is too long, RNN has affected by last data more and affected by prev data little.
LSTM can solve this problem by its specific structure.

Input data

Game server leaves ‘game log’ which is created by user’s action. There are many game log type in NCSOFT’s game log.
We will use some game log types below.

Category LogID LogName Description
Connection 1003 EnterWorld When user enters the game-server
Connection 1004 LeaveWorld When user leaves the game-server
Connection 1005 EnterZone When user enters the zone
Connection 1006 LeaveZone When user leaves the zone
Connection 1010 Teleport When user teleported using the magical method
Connection 1013 PCLevelUp When user’s character leveled up
Character 1016 GetExperience When actor gets Exp
Character 1022 GetItem When the items in the inventory are increased
Character 1102 JoinParty When user joined the party
Character 1202 Die When actor died
Character 1209 KillPC When actor killed PC

We have to pre-process this data. We will group data with ‘userId’ and ‘date’.
But there is too many data to pre-process, so we will choose some userId to use.

PROJECT_HOME: String = /Users/leeyh0216/Documents/projects/bns_churn_prediction
gamelogDir: String = /Users/leeyh0216/Documents/projects/bns_churn_prediction/data/gamelog
aggregateResultDir: String = /Users/leeyh0216/Documents/projects/bns_churn_prediction/data/aggregate

paragraphs.text:
spark.sqlContext.read
    .format("com.databricks.spark.csv")
    .option("header", "true")
    .option("inferSchema", "true")
    .load(s"$gamelogDir/traindata_2/alpha/*")
    .withColumn("time", date_format(col("time"), "yyyy-MM-dd"))
    .groupBy("actor_account_id","time")
    .agg(
        count("*").as("logCnt")
        ,max(col("actor_level")).as("maxLevel")
        ,max(col("actor_masterylevel")).as("maxMasteryLevel")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1016, true)).as("expCnt")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1017, true)).as("getMoney")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1018, true)).as("spendMoney")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1022, true)).as("getItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1023, true)).as("loseItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1102, true)).as("partyCnt")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1209, true)).as("killCnt")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 1202, true)).as("deadCnt")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2001, true)).as("lootItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2002, true)).as("useItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2004, true)).as("destroyItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2121, true)).as("growUpItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2126 and $"log_detail_code" === 1, true)).as("growUpSuccess")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2126 and $"log_detail_code" === 2, true)).as("growUpFail")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2201, true)).as("tradeGiveItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 2202, true)).as("tradeGetItem")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 4001, true)).as("acquireSkill")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 4002, true)).as("skillLevelUp")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 5001, true)).as("acquireQuest")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 5004, true)).as("completeQuest")
        ,count(when($"logid" === 5008, true)).as("getQuestSkill")
    )
    .coalesce(20)
    .write
    .option("header", "true")
    .option("delimiter",",").csv(aggregateResultDir)

//Load Aggregated Data
spark.sqlContext.read
    .format("com.databricks.spark.csv")
    .option("header","true")
    .option("inferSchema","true")
    .load(s"$aggregateResultDir/*.csv")
    .registerTempTable("aggregatedData")
    
val user1 = spark.sqlContext.sql(s"select * from aggregatedData where actor_account_id='AFC409F2'").sort(asc("time"))
z.show(user1)
